article.text: Over the weekend, OPPO invited some fans to the preview of their brand new OPPO Reno 10x Zoom. I was lucky enough to be one of them and got to try out its cameras.
I am sure many of you want to know how the cameras on the Reno compares to Huawei’s P30 Pro. So without further ado, let’s take a look at what OPPO Reno 10x Zoom is capable of.
Rear Cameras – Is 60x Digital Zoom a Gimmick?

OPPO Reno 10x Zoom features a triple camera setup on the rear. There is a 48MP main camera, a 13MP telephoto camera, as well as an 8MP wide-angle camera. Similar to the Huawei P30 Pro, this telephoto camera has a periscope-like design. Both the main and telephoto camera have OIS.

And like the P30 Pro, Reno 10x Zoom is capable of up to 5x optical zoom and 10x hybrid. (Hence the name) Strangely, OPPO’s quick zoom toggle switches to 6x instead of 5x. Additionally, it has digital zoom up to 60x, higher than the P30 Pro’s 50x. Is it any better though?
L – OPPO Reno 10x Zoom (wide, 1x, 6x, 10x, 60x), R – Huawei P30 Pro (wide, 1x, 5x, 10x, 50x)

The zooming quality seems on par for the most part. However, I do feel that the 50x zoom on the P30 Pro looks a little sharper, when cropped to match the Reno’s 60x zoom. OPPO Reno 10x Zoom produces colors that are generally more accurate, but Huawei P30 Pro’s photos look more pleasing to the eye.
Both are capable of super macro shots that let you focus on super close up subjects. Huawei and OPPO enables macro mode automatically with AI, but Huawei also let you enable it manually.
L – OPPO Reno 10x Zoom, R – Huawei P30 Pro
Both do a great job at focusing near subjects, but produces very different photos. Again, Huawei P30 Pro produces colors that are clearly over-saturated, but it looks more pleasing.

Portrait mode is very impressive. Zoom in on the image and you will see that it did a fantastic job detecting edges. Also, the parts between my fingers were positively identified as background, and blurred out. I look forward to putting it up against more complex subjects.

OPPO Reno 10x Zoom features the same “shark fin” popup mechanism found on the regular Reno. It has a single 16MP front-facing camera which doesn’t sound too impressive, but it is actually really good.
Pricing & Availability – On Sale 15th June, Preorder Now

OPPO Reno 10x Zoom is available for preorder at S$1198 at OPPO Concept Stores and official Lazada store. OPPO is giving out free gifts worth over S$500 if you preorder the OPPO Reno 10x Zoom from now till 14th June. It will go on sales island-wide this Saturday, 15th June.
It’s rear cameras may not be as capable as the Huawei P30 Pro’s, but it gets quite close. And at S$200 less than the P30 Pro, I would say the difference is more than justified.
